main event: A reddish-white light was observed on St. Lawrence Island, Alaska, staying immobile and appearing three times at five-minute intervals.
interesting points: The observation lasted for 25 minutes, giving the witnesses ample time to study the object.
The light was approximately 200 yards away from the observers, providing a relatively close view of the object.
The source of the observation was a civilian, adding credibility to the report.
The conclusion suggests that the light could possibly be a sea vessel pilot light, indicating a potential prosaic explanation.
The report is on file in the ATIC repository, indicating an official record of the observation.
